chargeHist.descr: Ignition Interlock Device Tampering/Failure to Install/Violate Court Order

result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

records.addlTxt: Review hearing on December 22, 2022 at 08:30 am.
State's Response to the Defendant's Amended Motions
State's Motion to Deny the Defendant's Motion to Suppress without an Evidentiary Hearing
Review hearing on October 21, 2022 at 02:45 pm.

3:03 PM Defendant Garett L Thomas in court.  Attorney Terry L. Nussberger in court for Garett L Thomas.  Attorney Emily Nelson appeared by video for State of Wisconsin. Heard along with 22CM6, 22CM43.  Parties awaiting lab results in 22CM43.  Atty Nussberger will file a Motion within 10 days.
Review hearing scheduled for October 21, 2022 at 02:45 pm.

Review hearing on September 6, 2022 at 03:00 pm.

2:25 PM Defendant Garett L Thomas in court.  Attorney Terry L. Nussberger in court for Garett L Thomas.  Attorney Annette Barna in court for State of Wisconsin. Heard along with 22CM6, 22CM43.  Set for RH September 6,2022 @ 3:00PM
Review hearing on June 7, 2022 at 02:00 pm.

02:08 PM Defendant Garett L Thomas in court. Attorney Emily Margaret Nelson in court for Plaintiff State of Wisconsin.  Both cases 22CM6 and 22CM43 heard together.  Court appointed Attorney Nussberger as Attorney for DE on both cases.  DE received CMP.  Court granted 30 days to file motions on 22CM43.    Bond in 22CM43 is $2500 sign bond with conditions   Defendant is not to consume or possess alcohol.  Do not enter premises where alcohol is primary business, any bars taverns or liquor stores or any other establishment where the primary purpose is the sale of alcohol.  No possession/consumption or use of illegal or illicit drugs, or any substance intended to use to alter mental state or mood.  Not to possess any drug paraphernalia.  No possession of medications not prescribed to you by a physician.  Do not operate a motor vehicle without a valid operating privilege.   RH set on both cases for 6/7/22 at 2:00 PM.   Adj. 2:10 PM
Initial appearance on March 22, 2022 at 01:00 pm.
